1.title: Introduction to D3 and SVG
1.code:
/**
 * @bookmark
 * This is the D3 logo taken right from their website.
 */
var D3Logo = () => (
  <svg width={96} height={96}>
    <clipPath id="clip">
      <path
        d={`
          M0,0
          h7.75
          a45.5,45.5 0 1 1 0,91
          h-7.75
          v-20
          h7.75
          a25.5,25.5 0 1 0 0,-51
          h-7.75
          z
          m36.2510,0
          h32
          a27.75,27.75 0 0 1 21.331,45.5
          a27.75,27.75 0 0 1 -21.331,45.5
          h-32
          a53.6895,53.6895 0 0 0 18.7464,-20
          h13.2526
          a7.75,7.75 0 1 0 0,-15.5
          h-7.75
          a53.6895,53.6895 0 0 0 0,-20
          h7.75
          a7.75,7.75 0 1 0 0,-15.5
          h-13.2526
          a53.6895,53.6895 0 0 0 -18.7464,-20
          z
        `} />
    </clipPath>
    <linearGradient
      id="gradient-1"
      gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse"
      x1={7}
      y1={64}
      x2={50}
      y2={107}
    >
      <stop offset="0" stopColor="#f9a03c" />
      <stop offset="1" stopColor="#f7974e" />
    </linearGradient>
    <linearGradient
      id="gradient-2"
      gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse"
      x1="2"
      y1="-2"
      x2="87"
      y2="84"
    >
      <stop offset="0" stopColor="#f26d58" />
      <stop offset="1" stopColor="#f9a03c" />
    </linearGradient>
    <linearGradient
      id="gradient-3"
      gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse"
      x1={45}
      y1={-10}
      x2={108}
      y2={53}
    >
      <stop offset="0" stopColor="#b84e51" />
      <stop offset="1" stopColor="#f68e48" />
    </linearGradient>
    <g clipPath="url(#clip)">
      <path d="M-100,-102m-27,0v300h300z" fill="url(#gradient-1)" />
      <path d="M-100,-102m27,0h300v300z" fill="url(#gradient-3)" />
      <path
        d="M-100,-102l300,300"
        fill="none"
        stroke="url(#gradient-2)"
        strokeWidth={40}
      />
    </g>
  </svg>
);

/**
 * @bookmark
 * Here's some reusable text for our slide.
 */
var SlideText = (props) => (
  <text
    textAnchor="middle"
    alignmentBaseline="central"
    fill="white"
    fontFamily="Poppins"
    fontSize={112}
    {...props}
  >
    {props.children}
  </text>
);

/**
 * @bookmark
 * This is the footer (with Pandera Labs and such).
 */
var SlideFooter = () => (
  <g transform="translate(0, 1004)">
    <rect width="100%" height="100%" fill="white" />
    <image href="../images/pandera-labs.png" x={1135} y={0} width={305} />
  </g>
);

/**
 * @bookmark
 * This is the whole kit and caboodle!
 */
var Slide = () => (
  <svg viewBox="0 0 1440 1080" className="wrapper">
    <rect x={0} y={0} width="100%" height="100%" fill="#3274B7" />
    <SlideText x="43%" y="40%">Introduction to</SlideText>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 800 800" x="61%" y="35%">
      <D3Logo />
    </svg>
    <SlideText x="50%" y="50%">and SVG</SlideText>
    <SlideFooter />
  </svg>
);

/**
 * @bookmark
 * This method is required to render the React component, there's
 * some mojo going on behind the scenes.
 */
render(<Slide />);

2.title: A Quick Overview of SVG

6.title: What about D3?

7.title: The Building Blocks of a Chart
7.code:
var Slide = () => (
  <SlideTemplate>
    <BulletedList>
      <BulletPoint>
        The basic elements of a D3 chart are:
      </BulletPoint>
      <BulletPoint level={1}>Scales</BulletPoint>
      <BulletPoint level={1}>Domain</BulletPoint>
      <BulletPoint level={1}>Range</BulletPoint>
      <BulletPoint level={1}>Data</BulletPoint>
      <BulletPoint level={1}>Axes</BulletPoint>
      <BulletPoint>
        {"Let's start with the scales, domain, and range"}
      </BulletPoint>
    </BulletedList>
  </SlideTemplate>
)

render(<Slide />);
